column4: Any hint's to my EPP problem? dmesg | parport0 lists "parport0: PC-style at 0x378, irq 7 [PCSPP,TRISTATE] " Nothing about EPP... :-(
I meant dmesg | grep parport0
Maybe one of you could do a dmesg | grep parport0 so that we can see, if it's a general ubuntu problem?
i have my parport working
parport is working for printer but not scanner?
correct
what does it say if you have the scanner plugged in on boot
the same! it is plugged in all the time
do you have both a brother printer and a scanner plugged in?
yes, both! the printer is plugged into the scanner
it works under fedora core 2
i tried this...
what happens when you try to access the scanner
how do you usually access the scanner, through sane?
xsane states, that it cannot find any devices
don't try that yet.

I will try this. Wait a minute. But I'm sure, that this have to do with the EPP mode. This is the only difference I could find between my Fedora and ubuntu installations in this matter. yes, i tried the ppdiag script. It also states, that I do not have the EPP mode activated.
what kernel are you using
do you have the EPP mode activated AND detected by ubuntu?
yes, i get: parport0: PC-style at 0x378 (0x778), irq 7, dma 3 [PCSPP,TRISTATE,COMPAT,ECP,DMA]
what does uname -a give you?
yeah, you are right... okay, thanks for your help!
